codeBlocks.content:
# PowerShell script to set up Git auto-backup for Cursor chats
# Run this as Administrator for best results

Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "Git Auto-Backup Setup for Cursor Chats" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""

$backupDir = "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
$projectDir = Get-Location

# Create backup directory
if (-not (Test-Path $backupDir)) {
    New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $backupDir -Force | Out-Null
    Write-Host "âœ“ Created backup directory: $backupDir" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# Initialize Git if needed
Set-Location $backupDir
if (-not (Test-Path ".git")) {
    git init
    Write-Host "âœ“ Initialized Git repository" -ForegroundColor Green
    
    # Create initial README
    @"
# Cursor Chat Backups

This repository automatically backs up all Cursor chat conversations.

## Setup

This backup is configured to run automatically every 5 minutes.

## Manual Backup

Run: `auto-backup.bat`

## Restore

All conversations are saved in the `conversations` folder.
"@ | Out-File -FilePath "README.md" -Encoding UTF8
    
    git add README.md
    git commit -m "Initial commit - Cursor chat backups"
}

# Create auto-backup script
$autoBackupScript = @"
@echo off
REM Auto-backup Cursor chats to Git
cd /d "$backupDir"

REM Copy SpecStory conversations
if exist "$projectDir\.specstory" (
    if not exist "conversations" mkdir "conversations"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "$projectDir\.specstory" "conversations\" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Copy Cursor database
set CURSOR_DATA=%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\globalStorage
if exist "%CURSOR_DATA%\state.vscdb" (
    if not exist "databases" mkdir "databases"
    copy /Y "%CURSOR_DATA%\state.vscdb" "databases\state.vscdb" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Copy workspace storage
if exist "%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" (
    if not exist "workspace-storage" mkdir "workspace-storage"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" "workspace-storage\" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Git operations
git add -A
git commit -m "Auto-backup: %date% %time%" --allow-empty >nul 2>&1

REM Push to remote if configured
git push origin main >nul 2>&1 || git push origin master >nul 2>&1

REM Sync to OneDrive if available
if exist "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive" (
    if not exist "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups" mkdir "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "$backupDir" "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups\" >nul 2>&1
)
"@

$autoBackupScript | Out-File -FilePath "$backupDir\auto-backup.bat" -Encoding ASCII

Write-Host "âœ“ Created auto-backup script" -ForegroundColor Green

# Create scheduled task
$taskName = "CursorChatAutoBackup"
$taskExists = Get-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

if ($taskExists) {
    Write-Host "âš  Scheduled task already exists. Updating..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Unregister-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -Confirm:$false
}

$action = New-ScheduledTaskAction -Execute "$backupDir\auto-backup.bat"
$trigger = New-ScheduledTaskTrigger -Once -At (Get-Date) -RepetitionInterval (New-TimeSpan -Minutes 5) -RepetitionDuration (New-TimeSpan -Days 365)
$principal = New-ScheduledTaskPrincipal -UserId $env:USERNAME -RunLevel Highest
$settings = New-ScheduledTaskSettingsSet -AllowStartIfOnBatteries -DontStopIfGoingOnBatteries -StartWhenAvailable

try {
    Register-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -Action $action -Trigger $trigger -Principal $principal -Settings $settings -Description "Automatically backs up Cursor chat conversations every 5 minutes" -Force
    Write-Host "âœ“ Created scheduled task (runs every 5 minutes)" -ForegroundColor Green
} catch {
    Write-Host "âš  Could not create scheduled task. You may need to run as Administrator." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Write-Host "  Error: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
}

# Create Git remote setup script
$gitSetupScript = @"
@echo off
echo ================================================================================
echo Git Remote Setup
echo ================================================================================
echo.
echo To backup to GitHub/GitLab, you need to:
echo 1. Create a repository on GitHub/GitLab
echo 2. Copy the repository URL
echo 3. Run the commands below
echo.
echo Example:
echo   git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups.git
echo   git branch -M main
echo   git push -u origin main
echo.
pause
"@

$gitSetupScript | Out-File -FilePath "$backupDir\setup-git-remote.bat" -Encoding ASCII

Write-Host ""
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "Setup Complete!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Backup directory: $backupDir" -ForegroundColor Yellow
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Next steps:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "1. Install SpecStory extension in Cursor (see INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md)" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "2. (Optional) Set up Git remote:" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "   cd `"$backupDir`"" -ForegroundColor Gray
Write-Host "   .\setup-git-remote.bat" -ForegroundColor Gray
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Your chats will now be automatically backed up every 5 minutes!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host ""

Set-Location $projectDir

# Run this as Administrator for best results

Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "Git Auto-Backup Setup for Cursor Chats" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""

$backupDir = "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
$projectDir = Get-Location

# Create backup directory
if (-not (Test-Path $backupDir)) {
    New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $backupDir -Force | Out-Null
    Write-Host "âœ“ Created backup directory: $backupDir" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# Initialize Git if needed
Set-Location $backupDir
if (-not (Test-Path ".git")) {
    git init
    Write-Host "âœ“ Initialized Git repository" -ForegroundColor Green
    
    # Create initial README
    @"
# Cursor Chat Backups

This repository automatically backs up all Cursor chat conversations.

## Setup

This backup is configured to run automatically every 5 minutes.

## Manual Backup

Run: `auto-backup.bat`

## Restore

All conversations are saved in the `conversations` folder.
"@ | Out-File -FilePath "README.md" -Encoding UTF8
    
    git add README.md
    git commit -m "Initial commit - Cursor chat backups"
}

# Create auto-backup script
$autoBackupScript = @"
@echo off
REM Auto-backup Cursor chats to Git
cd /d "$backupDir"

REM Copy SpecStory conversations
if exist "$projectDir\.specstory" (
    if not exist "conversations" mkdir "conversations"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "$projectDir\.specstory" "conversations\" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Copy Cursor database
set CURSOR_DATA=%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\globalStorage
if exist "%CURSOR_DATA%\state.vscdb" (
    if not exist "databases" mkdir "databases"
    copy /Y "%CURSOR_DATA%\state.vscdb" "databases\state.vscdb" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Copy workspace storage
if exist "%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" (
    if not exist "workspace-storage" mkdir "workspace-storage"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" "workspace-storage\" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Git operations
git add -A
git commit -m "Auto-backup: %date% %time%" --allow-empty >nul 2>&1

REM Push to remote if configured
git push origin main >nul 2>&1 || git push origin master >nul 2>&1

REM Sync to OneDrive if available
if exist "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive" (
    if not exist "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups" mkdir "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "$backupDir" "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups\" >nul 2>&1
)
"@

$autoBackupScript | Out-File -FilePath "$backupDir\auto-backup.bat" -Encoding ASCII

Write-Host "âœ“ Created auto-backup script" -ForegroundColor Green

# Create scheduled task
$taskName = "CursorChatAutoBackup"
$taskExists = Get-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

if ($taskExists) {
    Write-Host "âš  Scheduled task already exists. Updating..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Unregister-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -Confirm:$false
}

$action = New-ScheduledTaskAction -Execute "$backupDir\auto-backup.bat"
$trigger = New-ScheduledTaskTrigger -Once -At (Get-Date) -RepetitionInterval (New-TimeSpan -Minutes 5) -RepetitionDuration (New-TimeSpan -Days 365)
$principal = New-ScheduledTaskPrincipal -UserId $env:USERNAME -RunLevel Highest
$settings = New-ScheduledTaskSettingsSet -AllowStartIfOnBatteries -DontStopIfGoingOnBatteries -StartWhenAvailable

try {
    Register-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -Action $action -Trigger $trigger -Principal $principal -Settings $settings -Description "Automatically backs up Cursor chat conversations every 5 minutes" -Force
    Write-Host "âœ“ Created scheduled task (runs every 5 minutes)" -ForegroundColor Green
} catch {
    Write-Host "âš  Could not create scheduled task. You may need to run as Administrator." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Write-Host "  Error: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
}

# Create Git remote setup script
$gitSetupScript = @"
@echo off
echo ================================================================================
echo Git Remote Setup
echo ================================================================================
echo.
echo To backup to GitHub/GitLab, you need to:
echo 1. Create a repository on GitHub/GitLab
echo 2. Copy the repository URL
echo 3. Run the commands below
echo.
echo Example:
echo   git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups.git
echo   git branch -M main
echo   git push -u origin main
echo.
pause
"@

$gitSetupScript | Out-File -FilePath "$backupDir\setup-git-remote.bat" -Encoding ASCII

Write-Host ""
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "Setup Complete!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Backup directory: $backupDir" -ForegroundColor Yellow
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Next steps:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "1. Install SpecStory extension in Cursor (see INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md)" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "2. (Optional) Set up Git remote:" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "   cd `"$backupDir`"" -ForegroundColor Gray
Write-Host "   .\setup-git-remote.bat" -ForegroundColor Gray
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Your chats will now be automatically backed up every 5 minutes!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host ""

Set-Location $projectDir
"}

codeBlocks.content:
# Complete Auto-Backup Setup Guide for Cursor Chats

## ðŸŽ¯ **Goal**

Set up **automatic backup** of ALL Cursor chats to:
- âœ… Git repository (auto-commit every 5 minutes)
- âœ… OneDrive/Google Drive (auto-sync)
- âœ… Local backup folder

**NO MANUAL WORK REQUIRED!**

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Step-by-Step Setup**

### **Step 1: Install SpecStory Extension** â­ **REQUIRED**

SpecStory automatically saves all conversations to `.specstory` folder.

1. **Open Cursor**
2. **Press `Ctrl+Shift+X`** (Extensions)
3. **Search:** `SpecStory`
4. **Click Install**
5. **Done!** Conversations will auto-save

**OR** see `INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md` for detailed instructions.

---

### **Step 2: Set Up Auto-Backup**

#### **Option A: Quick Setup (Recommended)**

1. **Run:** `setup_auto_backup_cursor_chats.bat`
   - Double-click the file
   - Follow the prompts
   - Done!

#### **Option B: PowerShell Setup (More Control)**

1. **Right-click** `setup_git_auto_backup.ps1`
2. **Select:** "Run with PowerShell"
3. **If prompted:** Click "Yes" to allow script execution
4. **Done!**

---

### **Step 3: Configure Git Remote (Optional but Recommended)**

This backs up to GitHub/GitLab for cloud storage.

1. **Create a GitHub repository:**
   - Go to https://github.com/new
   - Name it: `cursor-chat-backups`
   - Make it **Private** (recommended)
   - Click "Create repository"

2. **Set up remote:**
   ```bash
   cd "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups.git
   git branch -M main
   git push -u origin main
   ```

3. **Done!** Chats will auto-push to GitHub every 5 minutes.

---

### **Step 4: Verify Setup**

1. **Check scheduled task:**
   - Press `Win+R`
   - Type: `taskschd.msc`
   - Look for: `CursorChatAutoBackup`
   - Should run every 5 minutes

2. **Check backup folder:**
   - Go to: `C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups`
   - Should contain: `conversations`, `databases` folders

3. **Test backup:**
   - Have a conversation in Cursor
   - Wait 5 minutes
   - Check if it appears in backup folder

---

## ðŸ”„ **How It Works**

### **Automatic Process:**

1. **SpecStory** saves conversations to `.specstory` folder
2. **Auto-backup script** runs every 5 minutes:
   - Copies `.specstory` to backup folder
   - Copies Cursor database
   - Commits to Git
   - Pushes to GitHub (if configured)
   - Syncs to OneDrive (if available)

### **What Gets Backed Up:**

- âœ… All conversation text
- âœ… Code blocks
- âœ… File changes
- âœ… Tool results
- âœ… Complete conversation history

---

## ðŸ“ **Backup Locations**

### **Local Backup:**
```
C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\
â”œâ”€â”€ conversations\     (SpecStory conversations)
â”œâ”€â”€ databases\         (Cursor database backups)
â””â”€â”€ workspace-storage\ (Workspace data)
```

### **OneDrive Sync:**
```
C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups\
```

### **GitHub (if configured):**
```
https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups
```

---

## âš™ï¸ **Configuration**

### **Change Backup Frequency**

Edit scheduled task:
1. Open `taskschd.msc`
2. Find `CursorChatAutoBackup`
3. Right-click â†’ Properties
4. Triggers tab â†’ Edit
5. Change "Repeat task every" to desired interval

### **Disable Auto-Backup**

```bash
schtasks /Delete /TN "CursorChatAutoBackup" /F
```

### **Manual Backup**

Run anytime:
```bash
"%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\auto-backup.bat"
```

---

## ðŸ” **Troubleshooting**

### **Backup Not Running?**

1. **Check scheduled task:**
   - Open Task Scheduler (`taskschd.msc`)
   - Verify `CursorChatAutoBackup` exists and is enabled

2. **Run manually:**
   ```bash
   "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\auto-backup.bat"
   ```

3. **Check permissions:**
   - Run setup script as Administrator
   - Ensure Git is installed

### **Git Push Failing?**

1. **Check remote:**
   ```bash
   cd "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   git remote -v
   ```

2. **Reconfigure:**
   ```bash
   git remote remove origin
   git remote add origin YOUR_REPO_URL
   git push -u origin main
   ```

### **SpecStory Not Saving?**

1. **Verify installation:**
   - Check Extensions in Cursor
   - Ensure SpecStory is enabled

2. **Check folder:**
   - Look for `.specstory` folder in your project
   - If missing, restart Cursor

---

## âœ… **Verification Checklist**

- [ ] SpecStory extension installed
- [ ] Scheduled task created (`CursorChatAutoBackup`)
- [ ] Backup folder exists
- [ ] Git repository initialized
- [ ] Git remote configured (optional)
- [ ] OneDrive sync working (if available)
- [ ] Test backup successful

---

## ðŸŽ‰ **You're Done!**

Your Cursor chats are now **automatically backed up** every 5 minutes to:
- âœ… Local backup folder
- âœ… Git repository
- âœ… GitHub (if configured)
- âœ… OneDrive (if available)

**No manual work needed!** Just chat normally and everything is saved automatically.

---

## ðŸ“ž **Need Help?**

- Check `INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md` for SpecStory setup
- Run `setup-git-remote.bat` for Git configuration
- Check backup folder for recent backups

## ðŸŽ¯ **Goal**

Set up **automatic backup** of ALL Cursor chats to:
- âœ… Git repository (auto-commit every 5 minutes)
- âœ… OneDrive/Google Drive (auto-sync)
- âœ… Local backup folder

**NO MANUAL WORK REQUIRED!**

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Step-by-Step Setup**

### **Step 1: Install SpecStory Extension** â­ **REQUIRED**

SpecStory automatically saves all conversations to `.specstory` folder.

1. **Open Cursor**
2. **Press `Ctrl+Shift+X`** (Extensions)
3. **Search:** `SpecStory`
4. **Click Install**
5. **Done!** Conversations will auto-save

**OR** see `INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md` for detailed instructions.

---

### **Step 2: Set Up Auto-Backup**

#### **Option A: Quick Setup (Recommended)**

1. **Run:** `setup_auto_backup_cursor_chats.bat`
   - Double-click the file
   - Follow the prompts
   - Done!

#### **Option B: PowerShell Setup (More Control)**

1. **Right-click** `setup_git_auto_backup.ps1`
2. **Select:** "Run with PowerShell"
3. **If prompted:** Click "Yes" to allow script execution
4. **Done!**

---

### **Step 3: Configure Git Remote (Optional but Recommended)**

This backs up to GitHub/GitLab for cloud storage.

1. **Create a GitHub repository:**
   - Go to https://github.com/new
   - Name it: `cursor-chat-backups`
   - Make it **Private** (recommended)
   - Click "Create repository"

2. **Set up remote:**
   ```bash
   cd "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups.git
   git branch -M main
   git push -u origin main
   ```

3. **Done!** Chats will auto-push to GitHub every 5 minutes.

---

### **Step 4: Verify Setup**

1. **Check scheduled task:**
   - Press `Win+R`
   - Type: `taskschd.msc`
   - Look for: `CursorChatAutoBackup`
   - Should run every 5 minutes

2. **Check backup folder:**
   - Go to: `C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups`
   - Should contain: `conversations`, `databases` folders

3. **Test backup:**
   - Have a conversation in Cursor
   - Wait 5 minutes
   - Check if it appears in backup folder

---

## ðŸ”„ **How It Works**

### **Automatic Process:**

1. **SpecStory** saves conversations to `.specstory` folder
2. **Auto-backup script** runs every 5 minutes:
   - Copies `.specstory` to backup folder
   - Copies Cursor database
   - Commits to Git
   - Pushes to GitHub (if configured)
   - Syncs to OneDrive (if available)

### **What Gets Backed Up:**

- âœ… All conversation text
- âœ… Code blocks
- âœ… File changes
- âœ… Tool results
- âœ… Complete conversation history

---

## ðŸ“ **Backup Locations**

### **Local Backup:**
```
C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\
â”œâ”€â”€ conversations\     (SpecStory conversations)
â”œâ”€â”€ databases\         (Cursor database backups)
â””â”€â”€ workspace-storage\ (Workspace data)
```

### **OneDrive Sync:**
```
C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups\
```

### **GitHub (if configured):**
```
https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups
```

---

## âš™ï¸ **Configuration**

### **Change Backup Frequency**

Edit scheduled task:
1. Open `taskschd.msc`
2. Find `CursorChatAutoBackup`
3. Right-click â†’ Properties
4. Triggers tab â†’ Edit
5. Change "Repeat task every" to desired interval

### **Disable Auto-Backup**

```bash
schtasks /Delete /TN "CursorChatAutoBackup" /F
```

### **Manual Backup**

Run anytime:
```bash
"%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\auto-backup.bat"
```

---

## ðŸ” **Troubleshooting**

### **Backup Not Running?**

1. **Check scheduled task:**
   - Open Task Scheduler (`taskschd.msc`)
   - Verify `CursorChatAutoBackup` exists and is enabled

2. **Run manually:**
   ```bash
   "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\auto-backup.bat"
   ```

3. **Check permissions:**
   - Run setup script as Administrator
   - Ensure Git is installed

### **Git Push Failing?**

1. **Check remote:**
   ```bash
   cd "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   git remote -v
   ```

2. **Reconfigure:**
   ```bash
   git remote remove origin
   git remote add origin YOUR_REPO_URL
   git push -u origin main
   ```

### **SpecStory Not Saving?**

1. **Verify installation:**
   - Check Extensions in Cursor
   - Ensure SpecStory is enabled

2. **Check folder:**
   - Look for `.specstory` folder in your project
   - If missing, restart Cursor

---

## âœ… **Verification Checklist**

- [ ] SpecStory extension installed
- [ ] Scheduled task created (`CursorChatAutoBackup`)
- [ ] Backup folder exists
- [ ] Git repository initialized
- [ ] Git remote configured (optional)
- [ ] OneDrive sync working (if available)
- [ ] Test backup successful

---

## ðŸŽ‰ **You're Done!**

Your Cursor chats are now **automatically backed up** every 5 minutes to:
- âœ… Local backup folder
- âœ… Git repository
- âœ… GitHub (if configured)
- âœ… OneDrive (if available)

**No manual work needed!** Just chat normally and everything is saved automatically.

---

## ðŸ“ž **Need Help?**

- Check `INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md` for SpecStory setup
- Run `setup-git-remote.bat` for Git configuration
- Check backup folder for recent backups

{"summary":"Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
The user initially requested help recovering all lost chat conversations with Cursor, suggesting connecting the desktop to chat for recovery. After some recovery attempts, the user stated they could see some chats but couldn't open them. The user then specifically asked to recover conversations titled "Frappe Docker port and login issues" and "FQC5". Finally, the user stated that the recovered conversations did not have the full content or plan they wanted and explicitly requested that all Cursor chats be automatically uploaded to Git or any online drives without manual triggering, asking for instructions on how to achieve this.

2. Key Technical Concepts:
- Cursor chat history storage: SQLite databases (`state.vscdb`)
- Conversation data structure: `composerData`, `fullConversationHeadersOnly`, `conversationMap`, `richText`, `text`, `toolResults`, `codeBlocks`, `toolFormerData`.
- File system navigation and search (PowerShell commands).
- Python scripting for database interaction (sqlite3, json parsing).
- Git for version control and online backup.
- Cloud storage (GitHub, GitLab, OneDrive/Google Drive).
- Cursor extensions for automatic backup (SpecStory, Cursor Convo Export, Pieces Integration).
- PowerShell scripting for automated tasks (scheduled tasks, Git commands).

3. Files and Code Sections:
- `conversation-logs/`: Directory for conversation backups.
- `20251215-19-22-19-quick-note.md`: An example quick save file.
- `C:\Users\pc\AppData\Roaming\Cursor\User\History\`: Directory containing various history files (ps1, kt, md, py, ino, xml, bat, json).
- `C:\Users\pc\AppData\Roaming\Cursor\User\globalStorage\state.vscdb`: The primary SQLite database where Cursor stores global user data, including some chat-related information.
- `C:\Users\pc\AppData\Roaming\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage\<workspace_id>\state.vscdb`: Workspace-specific SQLite databases.
- `recover_cursor_chats.py`:
  - Summary: Initial Python script to find and extract data from Cursor's SQLite databases. It iterates through `globalStorage` and `workspaceStorage` directories, connects to `state.vscdb` and `state.vscdb.backup` files, and extracts data from `ItemTable` and `cursorDiskKV`. It saves raw table data to timestamped directories.
- `inspect_cursor_db.py`:
  - Summary: Python script to inspect the contents of `state.vscdb` databases, specifically looking at `ItemTable` and `cursorDiskKV` to understand their structure and content. It attempts to parse JSON values from `cursorDiskKV`.
- `extract_cursor_chats.py`:
  - Summary: Python script to extract chat conversations from the `globalStorage\state.vscdb` database. It looks for `composerData` keys in `cursorDiskKV` and attempts to reconstruct conversations.
- `deep_extract_chats.py`:
  - Summary: Python script for a more thorough extraction of chat-related data from `globalStorage\state.vscdb`, saving all found entries (from both `ItemTable` and `cursorDiskKV`) into text and JSON files.
- `CHAT_RECOVERY_SUMMARY.md`:
  - Summary: Markdown file summarizing the initial recovery attempts, findings (empty conversation containers), and recommended next steps for the user.
- `recover_all_cursor_data.bat`:
  - Summary: A batch script to re-run all the Python recovery scripts created.
- `recover_specific_chats.py`:
  - Summary: Python script to search for specific conversations by title (e.g., "Frappe Docker port and login issues", "FQC5") within the `globalStorage\state.vscdb` database.
- `find_all_conversation_titles.py`:
  - Summary: Python script to find all potential conversation titles or identifiers within the `globalStorage\state.vscdb` database, as titles are not directly stored in `composerData`.
- `extract_all_workspace_conversations.py`:
  - Summary: Python script to extract all conversation data from both global and workspace storage databases, then search for keywords like 'frappe', 'docker', and 'fqc' within the extracted data.
- `recover_frappe_fqc5.py`:
  - Summary: Python script to specifically extract and reconstruct conversations related to "Frappe Docker" and "FQC5" based on keywords found in the database.
- `RECOVERED_FRAPPE_1_11b622ee.txt`:
  - Summary: Recovered text file containing the "Frappe Docker" conversation.
- `RECOVERED_DOCKER_1_11b622ee.txt`:
  - Summary: Another recovered text file, which turned out to be the same conversation as `RECOVERED_FRAPPE_1_11b622ee.txt`.
- `RECONSTRUCTED_11b622ee-1cd8-478e-8.txt`:
  - Summary: A reconstructed text file of the "Lost chat recovery" conversation, containing 71 messages.
- `final_recovery_attempt.py`:
  - Summary: Python script for a final, comprehensive search across all databases for keywords related to "Frappe", "Docker", and "FQC5" to identify relevant composer IDs.
- `RECOVERY_SUMMARY_FRAPPE_FQC5.md`:
  - Summary: Markdown file summarizing the recovery of Frappe/Docker and FQC5 conversations, noting that the Frappe/Docker conversation was found, but FQC5 appeared empty.
- `export_full_conversations.py`:
  - Summary: Python script to export conversations, attempting to include all structured data (richText, codeBlocks, toolResults) that might have been missed in simpler text extractions.
- `COMPLETE_EXPORT_11b622ee-1cd8-478e-8.txt`:
  - Summary: A more complete text export of the "Frappe Docker / Lost Chat Recovery" conversation, containing 127 messages.
- `COMPLETE_EXPORT_11b622ee-1cd8-478e-8.json`:
  - Summary: The raw JSON data for the complete export of the "Frappe Docker / Lost Chat Recovery" conversation.
- `export_complete_from_database.py`:
  - Summary: Python script to directly extract all available content from the database for specific composer IDs, aiming to capture any missing bubbles or structured data.
- `ENHANCED_COMPLETE_EXPORT_11b622ee-1cd8-478e-8.txt`:
  - Summary: An enhanced text export of the "Frappe Docker / Lost Chat Recovery" conversation, specifically designed to extract and present content from the `toolFormerData` field, which often contains detailed assistant responses, code blocks, and tool results. This file is crucial for capturing the "full conversations and plan" the user requested.
- `setup_auto_backup_cursor_chats.bat`:
  - Summary: A batch script intended to set up automatic backup of Cursor chats.
- `INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md`:
  - Summary: Markdown file providing instructions for installing the SpecStory Cursor extension for automatic chat backups.
- `setup_git_auto_backup.ps1`:
  - Summary: A PowerShell script designed to set up automatic Git backup for Cursor chats. This script had a parsing error.
- `AUTO_BACKUP_SETUP_GUIDE.md`:
  - Summary: Markdown file providing a guide for setting up automatic backups.

4. Errors and fixes:
- **Error**: `Error calling tool: The tool call for codebase_search timed out after 12s`
  - **Fix**: No explicit fix was applied, but subsequent searches were more targeted or used different tools.
- **Error**: PowerShell command `Select-String -Pattern 'chat|conversation' -Path $cursorAppDataPath -Recurse -Include *.json,*.md,*.txt -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object { .Name -match 'chat|conversation' }` resulted in `.Name : The term '.Name' is not recognized...`
  - **Fix**: The `.Name` property access within `Where-Object` was incorrect. The correct way to access properties of objects piped to `Where-Object` is `$_.Name`. This was implicitly fixed in subsequent PowerShell commands by using correct syntax or switching to Python for more complex parsing.
- **Error**: PowerShell command `Select-String -Pattern 'frappe|docker|fqc5|FQC5' -CaseSensitive:False | Select-Object -First 10 Path, LineNumber` resulted in `Select-String : Cannot convert 'System.String' to the type 'System.Management.Automation.SwitchParameter' required by parameter 'CaseSensitive'.`
  - **Fix**: The `-CaseSensitive:False` syntax is incorrect. The correct way to specify a boolean parameter is `-CaseSensitive:$False`. This was not explicitly fixed in the conversation, but the intent was understood.
- **Error**: PowerShell script `setup_git_auto_backup.ps1` had a `ParserError: Unexpected token '}' in expression or statement.`
  - **Fix**: The script had a syntax error (an extra or misplaced closing brace). The current work is to fix this error.

5. Problem Solving:
- **Problem**: User lost all chat history.
  - **Solution**: Initiated a comprehensive search for Cursor's local data storage, identified SQLite databases, and developed Python scripts to extract raw data.
- **Problem**: Initial extraction showed empty conversation containers.
  - **Solution**: Performed deeper scans, inspected database structures, and identified that conversation content was stored in `cursorDiskKV` and required specific parsing.
- **Problem**: User could see chats in Cursor but not open them.
  - **Solution**: Focused on direct database extraction to bypass Cursor's UI, reconstructing conversations from individual message bubbles and structured data.
- **Problem**: Recovered conversations lacked "full content and plan."
  - **Solution**: Developed an enhanced extraction script to specifically parse `toolFormerData` and other structured fields, which contain detailed assistant responses, code, and tool results, leading to a more complete recovery.
- **Problem**: User wants automatic backup to Git/cloud.
  - **Solution**: Began developing a solution involving a Cursor extension (SpecStory) and PowerShell scripts for automated Git backups.

6. All user messages:
- `i lost the all chat and conversation that i had with cursor may be if u connect the desktop to chat you can recover the chat please help me recover my chat`
- `now i can see these chat but not able to open it`
- `recover Frappe Docker port and login issues and FQC5`
- `it doesnt have full converstations and plan that i wanted if it possible for you to export chat of there 2`
- `no i have lost everything now before starting anything i want each n every cursor chat to be automatically uploaded to the git or any online drives without me triggering it tell me ehat i can do`

7. Pending Tasks:
- Fix the PowerShell script `setup_git_auto_backup.ps1` to correctly set up automatic Git backup.
- Provide the user with a complete, working solution for automatic chat backups to Git and online drives.

8. Current Work:
The current work is focused on fixing the `ParserError: Unexpected token '}' in expression or statement.` in the `setup_git_auto_backup.ps1` PowerShell script. This script is part of the solution to the user's request to have "each n every cursor chat to be automatically uploaded to the git or any online drives without me triggering it".

9. Optional Next Step:
The next step is to fix the `setup_git_auto_backup.ps1` script.

{"contents":"# PowerShell script to set up Git auto-backup for Cursor chats
# Run this as Administrator for best results

Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "Git Auto-Backup Setup for Cursor Chats" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""

$backupDir = "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
$projectDir = Get-Location

# Create backup directory
if (-not (Test-Path $backupDir)) {
    New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $backupDir -Force | Out-Null
    Write-Host "âœ“ Created backup directory: $backupDir" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# Initialize Git if needed
Set-Location $backupDir
if (-not (Test-Path ".git")) {
    git init
    Write-Host "âœ“ Initialized Git repository" -ForegroundColor Green
    
    # Create initial README
    @"
# Cursor Chat Backups

This repository automatically backs up all Cursor chat conversations.

## Setup

This backup is configured to run automatically every 5 minutes.

## Manual Backup

Run: `auto-backup.bat`

## Restore

All conversations are saved in the `conversations` folder.
"@ | Out-File -FilePath "README.md" -Encoding UTF8
    
    git add README.md
    git commit -m "Initial commit - Cursor chat backups"
}

# Create auto-backup script
$autoBackupScript = @"
@echo off
REM Auto-backup Cursor chats to Git
cd /d "$backupDir"

REM Copy SpecStory conversations
if exist "$projectDir\.specstory" (
    if not exist "conversations" mkdir "conversations"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "$projectDir\.specstory" "conversations\" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Copy Cursor database
set CURSOR_DATA=%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\globalStorage
if exist "%CURSOR_DATA%\state.vscdb" (
    if not exist "databases" mkdir "databases"
    copy /Y "%CURSOR_DATA%\state.vscdb" "databases\state.vscdb" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Copy workspace storage
if exist "%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" (
    if not exist "workspace-storage" mkdir "workspace-storage"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" "workspace-storage\" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Git operations
git add -A
git commit -m "Auto-backup: %date% %time%" --allow-empty >nul 2>&1

REM Push to remote if configured
git push origin main >nul 2>&1 || git push origin master >nul 2>&1

REM Sync to OneDrive if available
if exist "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive" (
    if not exist "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups" mkdir "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "$backupDir" "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups\" >nul 2>&1
)
"@

$autoBackupScript | Out-File -FilePath "$backupDir\auto-backup.bat" -Encoding ASCII

Write-Host "âœ“ Created auto-backup script" -ForegroundColor Green

# Create scheduled task
$taskName = "CursorChatAutoBackup"
$taskExists = Get-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

if ($taskExists) {
    Write-Host "âš  Scheduled task already exists. Updating..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Unregister-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -Confirm:$false
}

$action = New-ScheduledTaskAction -Execute "$backupDir\auto-backup.bat"
$trigger = New-ScheduledTaskTrigger -Once -At (Get-Date) -RepetitionInterval (New-TimeSpan -Minutes 5) -RepetitionDuration (New-TimeSpan -Days 365)
$principal = New-ScheduledTaskPrincipal -UserId $env:USERNAME -RunLevel Highest
$settings = New-ScheduledTaskSettingsSet -AllowStartIfOnBatteries -DontStopIfGoingOnBatteries -StartWhenAvailable

try {
    Register-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -Action $action -Trigger $trigger -Principal $principal -Settings $settings -Description "Automatically backs up Cursor chat conversations every 5 minutes" -Force
    Write-Host "âœ“ Created scheduled task (runs every 5 minutes)" -ForegroundColor Green
} catch {
    Write-Host "âš  Could not create scheduled task. You may need to run as Administrator." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Write-Host "  Error: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
}

# Create Git remote setup script
$gitSetupScript = @"
@echo off
echo ================================================================================
echo Git Remote Setup
echo ================================================================================
echo.
echo To backup to GitHub/GitLab, you need to:
echo 1. Create a repository on GitHub/GitLab
echo 2. Copy the repository URL
echo 3. Run the commands below
echo.
echo Example:
echo   git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups.git
echo   git branch -M main
echo   git push -u origin main
echo.
pause
"@

$gitSetupScript | Out-File -FilePath "$backupDir\setup-git-remote.bat" -Encoding ASCII

Write-Host ""
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "Setup Complete!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Backup directory: $backupDir" -ForegroundColor Yellow
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Next steps:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "1. Install SpecStory extension in Cursor (see INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md)" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "2. (Optional) Set up Git remote:" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "   cd `"$backupDir`"" -ForegroundColor Gray
Write-Host "   .\setup-git-remote.bat" -ForegroundColor Gray
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Your chats will now be automatically backed up every 5 minutes!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host ""

Set-Location $projectDir

# Initialize Git if needed
Set-Location $backupDir
if (-not (Test-Path ".git")) {
    git init
    Write-Host "âœ“ Initialized Git repository" -ForegroundColor Green
    
    # Create initial README
    @"
# Cursor Chat Backups

This repository automatically backs up all Cursor chat conversations.

## Setup

This backup is configured to run automatically every 5 minutes.

## Manual Backup

Run: `auto-backup.bat`

## Restore

All conversations are saved in the `conversations` folder.

# Create auto-backup script

@echo off
REM Auto-backup Cursor chats to Git

REM Copy SpecStory conversations

REM Copy Cursor database
set CURSOR_DATA=%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\globalStorage

codeBlocks.content:
# PowerShell script to set up Git auto-backup for Cursor chats
# Run this as Administrator for best results

Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "Git Auto-Backup Setup for Cursor Chats" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""

$backupDir = "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
$projectDir = Get-Location

# Create backup directory
if (-not (Test-Path $backupDir)) {
    New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $backupDir -Force | Out-Null
    Write-Host "âœ“ Created backup directory: $backupDir" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# Initialize Git if needed
Set-Location $backupDir
if (-not (Test-Path ".git")) {
    git init
    Write-Host "âœ“ Initialized Git repository" -ForegroundColor Green
    
    # Create initial README
    $readmeContent = @"
# Cursor Chat Backups

This repository automatically backs up all Cursor chat conversations.

## Setup

This backup is configured to run automatically every 5 minutes.

## Manual Backup

Run: `auto-backup.bat`

## Restore

All conversations are saved in the `conversations` folder.
"@
    $readmeContent | Out-File -FilePath "README.md" -Encoding UTF8
    
    git add README.md
    git commit -m "Initial commit - Cursor chat backups"
}

# Create auto-backup script
$autoBackupContent = @"
@echo off
REM Auto-backup Cursor chats to Git
cd /d "$backupDir"

REM Copy SpecStory conversations
if exist "$projectDir\.specstory" (
    if not exist "conversations" mkdir "conversations"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "$projectDir\.specstory" "conversations\" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Copy Cursor database
set CURSOR_DATA=%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\globalStorage
if exist "%CURSOR_DATA%\state.vscdb" (
    if not exist "databases" mkdir "databases"
    copy /Y "%CURSOR_DATA%\state.vscdb" "databases\state.vscdb" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Copy workspace storage
if exist "%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" (
    if not exist "workspace-storage" mkdir "workspace-storage"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" "workspace-storage\" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Git operations
git add -A
git commit -m "Auto-backup: %date% %time%" --allow-empty >nul 2>&1

REM Push to remote if configured
git push origin main >nul 2>&1 || git push origin master >nul 2>&1

REM Sync to OneDrive if available
if exist "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive" (
    if not exist "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups" mkdir "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "$backupDir" "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups\" >nul 2>&1
)
"@

$autoBackupContent | Out-File -FilePath "$backupDir\auto-backup.bat" -Encoding ASCII

Write-Host "âœ“ Created auto-backup script" -ForegroundColor Green

# Create scheduled task
$taskName = "CursorChatAutoBackup"
$taskExists = Get-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

if ($taskExists) {
    Write-Host "âš  Scheduled task already exists. Updating..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Unregister-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -Confirm:$false
}

$action = New-ScheduledTaskAction -Execute "$backupDir\auto-backup.bat"
$trigger = New-ScheduledTaskTrigger -Once -At (Get-Date) -RepetitionInterval (New-TimeSpan -Minutes 5) -RepetitionDuration (New-TimeSpan -Days 365)
$principal = New-ScheduledTaskPrincipal -UserId $env:USERNAME -RunLevel Highest
$settings = New-ScheduledTaskSettingsSet -AllowStartIfOnBatteries -DontStopIfGoingOnBatteries -StartWhenAvailable

try {
    Register-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -Action $action -Trigger $trigger -Principal $principal -Settings $settings -Description "Automatically backs up Cursor chat conversations every 5 minutes" -Force | Out-Null
    Write-Host "âœ“ Created scheduled task (runs every 5 minutes)" -ForegroundColor Green
}
catch {
    Write-Host "âš  Could not create scheduled task. You may need to run as Administrator." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Write-Host "  Error: $($_.Exception.Message)" -ForegroundColor Red
}

# Create Git remote setup script
$gitSetupContent = @"
@echo off
echo ================================================================================
echo Git Remote Setup
echo ================================================================================
echo.
echo To backup to GitHub/GitLab, you need to:
echo 1. Create a repository on GitHub/GitLab
echo 2. Copy the repository URL
echo 3. Run the commands below
echo.
echo Example:
echo   git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups.git
echo   git branch -M main
echo   git push -u origin main
echo.
pause
"@

$gitSetupContent | Out-File -FilePath "$backupDir\setup-git-remote.bat" -Encoding ASCII

Write-Host ""
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "Setup Complete!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Backup directory: $backupDir" -ForegroundColor Yellow
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Next steps:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "1. Install SpecStory extension in Cursor (see INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md)" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "2. (Optional) Set up Git remote:" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "   cd `"$backupDir`"" -ForegroundColor Gray
Write-Host "   .\setup-git-remote.bat" -ForegroundColor Gray
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Your chats will now be automatically backed up every 5 minutes!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host ""

Set-Location $projectDir

    Write-Host "âœ“ Initialized Git repository" -ForegroundColor Green
    
    # Create initial README
    $readmeContent = @"
# Cursor Chat Backups

This repository automatically backs up all Cursor chat conversations.

## Setup

This backup is configured to run automatically every 5 minutes.

## Manual Backup

Run: `auto-backup.bat`

## Restore

All conversations are saved in the `conversations` folder.
"@
    $readmeContent | Out-File -FilePath "README.md" -Encoding UTF8
    
    git add README.md
    git commit -m "Initial commit - Cursor chat backups"
}

# Create auto-backup script
$autoBackupContent = @"
@echo off
REM Auto-backup Cursor chats to Git
cd /d "$backupDir"

REM Copy SpecStory conversations
if exist "$projectDir\.specstory" (
    if not exist "conversations" mkdir "conversations"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "$projectDir\.specstory" "conversations\" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Copy Cursor database
set CURSOR_DATA=%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\globalStorage
if exist "%CURSOR_DATA%\state.vscdb" (
    if not exist "databases" mkdir "databases"
    copy /Y "%CURSOR_DATA%\state.vscdb" "databases\state.vscdb" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Copy workspace storage
if exist "%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" (
    if not exist "workspace-storage" mkdir "workspace-storage"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" "workspace-storage\" >nul 2>&1
)

REM Git operations
git add -A
git commit -m "Auto-backup: %date% %time%" --allow-empty >nul 2>&1

REM Push to remote if configured
git push origin main >nul 2>&1 || git push origin master >nul 2>&1

REM Sync to OneDrive if available
if exist "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive" (
    if not exist "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups" mkdir "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups"
    xcopy /E /I /Y "$backupDir" "%USERPROFILE%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups\" >nul 2>&1
)
"@

$autoBackupContent | Out-File -FilePath "$backupDir\auto-backup.bat" -Encoding ASCII

Write-Host "âœ“ Created auto-backup script" -ForegroundColor Green

# Create scheduled task
$taskName = "CursorChatAutoBackup"
$taskExists = Get-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

if ($taskExists) {
    Write-Host "âš  Scheduled task already exists. Updating..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Unregister-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -Confirm:$false
}

$action = New-ScheduledTaskAction -Execute "$backupDir\auto-backup.bat"
$trigger = New-ScheduledTaskTrigger -Once -At (Get-Date) -RepetitionInterval (New-TimeSpan -Minutes 5) -RepetitionDuration (New-TimeSpan -Days 365)
$principal = New-ScheduledTaskPrincipal -UserId $env:USERNAME -RunLevel Highest
$settings = New-ScheduledTaskSettingsSet -AllowStartIfOnBatteries -DontStopIfGoingOnBatteries -StartWhenAvailable

try {
    Register-ScheduledTask -TaskName $taskName -Action $action -Trigger $trigger -Principal $principal -Settings $settings -Description "Automatically backs up Cursor chat conversations every 5 minutes" -Force | Out-Null
    Write-Host "âœ“ Created scheduled task (runs every 5 minutes)" -ForegroundColor Green
}
catch {
    Write-Host "âš  Could not create scheduled task. You may need to run as Administrator." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Write-Host "  Error: $($_.Exception.Message)" -ForegroundColor Red
}

# Create Git remote setup script
$gitSetupContent = @"
@echo off
echo ================================================================================
echo Git Remote Setup
echo ================================================================================
echo.
echo To backup to GitHub/GitLab, you need to:
echo 1. Create a repository on GitHub/GitLab
echo 2. Copy the repository URL
echo 3. Run the commands below
echo.
echo Example:
echo   git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups.git
echo   git branch -M main
echo   git push -u origin main
echo.
pause
"@

$gitSetupContent | Out-File -FilePath "$backupDir\setup-git-remote.bat" -Encoding ASCII

Write-Host ""
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "Setup Complete!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host "================================================================================" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Backup directory: $backupDir" -ForegroundColor Yellow
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Next steps:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "1. Install SpecStory extension in Cursor (see INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md)" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "2. (Optional) Set up Git remote:" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "   cd `"$backupDir`"" -ForegroundColor Gray
Write-Host "   .\setup-git-remote.bat" -ForegroundColor Gray
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "Your chats will now be automatically backed up every 5 minutes!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host ""

Set-Location $projectDir
"}

codeBlocks.content:
@echo off
echo ================================================================================
echo QUICK SETUP - Automatic Cursor Chat Backup
echo ================================================================================
echo.
echo This will set up automatic backup of ALL Cursor chats.
echo.
pause

set BACKUP_DIR=%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups

echo.
echo Step 1: Creating backup directory...
if not exist "%BACKUP_DIR%" mkdir "%BACKUP_DIR%"

echo.
echo Step 2: Initializing Git repository...
cd /d "%BACKUP_DIR%"
if not exist ".git" (
    git init
    echo # Cursor Chat Backups > README.md
    echo. >> README.md
    echo This repository automatically backs up all Cursor chat conversations. >> README.md
    git add README.md
    git commit -m "Initial commit - Cursor chat backups"
    echo âœ“ Git repository initialized
)

echo.
echo Step 3: Creating auto-backup script...
(
echo @echo off
echo REM Auto-backup Cursor chats to Git
echo cd /d "%BACKUP_DIR%"
echo.
echo REM Copy SpecStory conversations from current project
echo if exist "%CD%\.specstory" (
echo     if not exist "conversations" mkdir "conversations"
echo     xcopy /E /I /Y "%CD%\.specstory" "conversations\" ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo )
echo.
echo REM Copy Cursor database
echo set CURSOR_DATA=%%APPDATA%%\Cursor\User\globalStorage
echo if exist "%%CURSOR_DATA%%\state.vscdb" (
echo     if not exist "databases" mkdir "databases"
echo     copy /Y "%%CURSOR_DATA%%\state.vscdb" "databases\state.vscdb" ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo )
echo.
echo REM Copy workspace storage
echo if exist "%%APPDATA%%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" (
echo     if not exist "workspace-storage" mkdir "workspace-storage"
echo     xcopy /E /I /Y "%%APPDATA%%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" "workspace-storage\" ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo )
echo.
echo REM Git operations
echo git add -A
echo git commit -m "Auto-backup: %%date%% %%time%%" --allow-empty ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo.
echo REM Push to remote if configured
echo git push origin main ^>nul 2^>^&1 || git push origin master ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo.
echo REM Sync to OneDrive if available
echo if exist "%%USERPROFILE%%\OneDrive" (
echo     if not exist "%%USERPROFILE%%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups" mkdir "%%USERPROFILE%%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups"
echo     xcopy /E /I /Y "%BACKUP_DIR%" "%%USERPROFILE%%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups\" ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo )
) > "%BACKUP_DIR%\auto-backup.bat"

echo âœ“ Auto-backup script created

echo.
echo Step 4: Creating scheduled task...
schtasks /Create /TN "CursorChatAutoBackup" /TR "%BACKUP_DIR%\auto-backup.bat" /SC MINUTE /MO 5 /F /RL HIGHEST 2>nul
if errorlevel 1 (
    echo âš  Could not create scheduled task automatically.
    echo   You may need to run this script as Administrator.
    echo   Or create the task manually using Task Scheduler.
) else (
    echo âœ“ Scheduled task created! Runs every 5 minutes.
)

echo.
echo Step 5: Creating Git remote setup helper...
(
echo @echo off
echo echo ================================================================================
echo echo Git Remote Setup
echo echo ================================================================================
echo echo.
echo echo To backup to GitHub/GitLab:
echo echo 1. Create a repository on GitHub/GitLab
echo echo 2. Copy the repository URL
echo echo 3. Run these commands:
echo echo.
echo echo    cd "%BACKUP_DIR%"
echo echo    git remote add origin YOUR_REPO_URL
echo echo    git branch -M main
echo echo    git push -u origin main
echo echo.
echo pause
) > "%BACKUP_DIR%\setup-git-remote.bat"

echo âœ“ Git setup helper created

echo.
echo ================================================================================
echo SETUP COMPLETE!
echo ================================================================================
echo.
echo Backup directory: %BACKUP_DIR%
echo.
echo Next steps:
echo 1. Install SpecStory extension in Cursor:
echo    - Press Ctrl+Shift+X in Cursor
echo    - Search: SpecStory
echo    - Click Install
echo.
echo 2. (Optional) Set up GitHub backup:
echo    - Run: %BACKUP_DIR%\setup-git-remote.bat
echo    - Follow the instructions
echo.
echo 3. Your chats will now auto-backup every 5 minutes!
echo.
echo To test: Have a conversation in Cursor, wait 5 minutes, then check:
echo   %BACKUP_DIR%\conversations
echo.
pause

codeBlocks.content:
# ðŸš€ START HERE - Automatic Cursor Chat Backup Setup

## âš ï¸ **IMPORTANT: You Lost Your Chats - Let's Prevent This Forever!**

I've created a complete automatic backup system. **Follow these steps in order:**

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Step 1: Install SpecStory Extension** â­ **DO THIS FIRST!**

SpecStory automatically saves ALL conversations to `.specstory` folder - **NO MANUAL WORK!**

### **Quick Install:**

1. **Open Cursor**
2. **Press `Ctrl+Shift+X`** (Extensions)
3. **Search:** `SpecStory`
4. **Click Install**
5. **Done!** Conversations auto-save immediately

**That's it!** SpecStory will now save every conversation automatically.

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Step 2: Set Up Auto-Backup to Git/Cloud**

### **Option A: Quick Setup (Easiest)**

1. **Double-click:** `QUICK_SETUP_AUTO_BACKUP.bat`
2. **Follow the prompts**
3. **Done!** Backups run every 5 minutes automatically

### **Option B: Manual Setup**

1. **Create backup folder:**
   ```bash
   mkdir "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   cd "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   ```

2. **Initialize Git:**
   ```bash
   git init
   echo # Cursor Chat Backups > README.md
   git add README.md
   git commit -m "Initial commit"
   ```

3. **Create auto-backup script:**
   - Copy the content from `auto-backup.bat` template
   - Save as `auto-backup.bat` in backup folder

4. **Create scheduled task:**
   ```bash
   schtasks /Create /TN "CursorChatAutoBackup" /TR "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\auto-backup.bat" /SC MINUTE /MO 5 /F /RL HIGHEST
   ```

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Step 3: Set Up GitHub Backup (Recommended)**

This backs up to GitHub so you never lose chats again!

1. **Create GitHub repository:**
   - Go to: https://github.com/new
   - Name: `cursor-chat-backups`
   - Make it **Private** âœ…
   - Click "Create repository"

2. **Connect to GitHub:**
   ```bash
   cd "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups.git
   git branch -M main
   git push -u origin main
   ```

3. **Done!** Chats auto-push to GitHub every 5 minutes!

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Step 4: Set Up OneDrive Sync (Optional)**

If you have OneDrive, backups will sync automatically:

1. **OneDrive sync is automatic** if you run `QUICK_SETUP_AUTO_BACKUP.bat`
2. **Or manually:** Copy backup folder to OneDrive

---

## âœ… **What Gets Backed Up Automatically**

Every 5 minutes, the system backs up:

- âœ… **All SpecStory conversations** (`.specstory` folder)
- âœ… **Cursor database** (`state.vscdb`)
- âœ… **Workspace storage** (all workspace data)
- âœ… **Everything committed to Git**
- âœ… **Pushed to GitHub** (if configured)
- âœ… **Synced to OneDrive** (if available)

---

## ðŸ”„ **How It Works**

```
Cursor Chat
    â†“
SpecStory Extension (auto-saves)
    â†“
.specstory folder
    â†“
Auto-backup script (every 5 min)
    â†“
Git commit + push
    â†“
GitHub + OneDrive
```

**You do NOTHING!** Just chat normally and everything is backed up automatically.

---

## ðŸ“ **Backup Locations**

### **Local:**
```
C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\
â”œâ”€â”€ conversations\     (SpecStory conversations)
â”œâ”€â”€ databases\         (Cursor database backups)
â””â”€â”€ workspace-storage\ (Workspace data)
```

### **GitHub:**
```
https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups
```

### **OneDrive:**
```
C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups\
```

---

## ðŸŽ¯ **Quick Start Checklist**

- [ ] **Step 1:** Install SpecStory extension in Cursor
- [ ] **Step 2:** Run `QUICK_SETUP_AUTO_BACKUP.bat`
- [ ] **Step 3:** Set up GitHub repository (optional but recommended)
- [ ] **Step 4:** Test - have a conversation, wait 5 minutes, check backup folder

---

## ðŸ§ª **Test Your Setup**

1. **Have a conversation in Cursor**
2. **Wait 5 minutes**
3. **Check:** `C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\conversations`
4. **You should see your conversation!**

---

## ðŸ”§ **Troubleshooting**

### **Backup Not Running?**

1. **Check scheduled task:**
   - Press `Win+R`
   - Type: `taskschd.msc`
   - Look for: `CursorChatAutoBackup`
   - Should be enabled and running

2. **Run manually:**
   ```bash
   "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\auto-backup.bat"
   ```

### **SpecStory Not Saving?**

1. **Verify installation:**
   - Check Extensions in Cursor
   - Ensure SpecStory is enabled

2. **Check folder:**
   - Look for `.specstory` folder in your project
   - If missing, restart Cursor

### **Git Push Failing?**

1. **Check remote:**
   ```bash
   cd "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   git remote -v
   ```

2. **Reconfigure:**
   ```bash
   git remote remove origin
   git remote add origin YOUR_REPO_URL
   git push -u origin main
   ```

---

## ðŸ“š **Files Created**

- `QUICK_SETUP_AUTO_BACKUP.bat` - Quick setup script
- `INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md` - SpecStory installation guide
- `AUTO_BACKUP_SETUP_GUIDE.md` - Detailed guide
- `setup_git_auto_backup.ps1` - PowerShell setup (alternative)

---

## ðŸŽ‰ **You're Done!**

After completing these steps:

âœ… **SpecStory** saves conversations automatically  
âœ… **Auto-backup** runs every 5 minutes  
âœ… **Git** commits and pushes automatically  
âœ… **GitHub** stores your chats in the cloud  
âœ… **OneDrive** syncs backups (if available)  

**You will NEVER lose your chats again!** ðŸŽŠ

---

## ðŸ’¡ **Important Notes**

1. **SpecStory is REQUIRED** - Without it, conversations won't be saved
2. **GitHub backup is RECOMMENDED** - Cloud storage prevents loss
3. **Backups run automatically** - No manual work needed
4. **Check backups regularly** - Verify they're working

---

## ðŸ†˜ **Need Help?**

- See `AUTO_BACKUP_SETUP_GUIDE.md` for detailed instructions
- See `INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md` for SpecStory help
- Check backup folder to verify backups are working

**Start with Step 1 (Install SpecStory) - it's the most important!**

## âš ï¸ **IMPORTANT: You Lost Your Chats - Let's Prevent This Forever!**

I've created a complete automatic backup system. **Follow these steps in order:**

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Step 1: Install SpecStory Extension** â­ **DO THIS FIRST!**

SpecStory automatically saves ALL conversations to `.specstory` folder - **NO MANUAL WORK!**

### **Quick Install:**

1. **Open Cursor**
2. **Press `Ctrl+Shift+X`** (Extensions)
3. **Search:** `SpecStory`
4. **Click Install**
5. **Done!** Conversations auto-save immediately

**That's it!** SpecStory will now save every conversation automatically.

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Step 2: Set Up Auto-Backup to Git/Cloud**

### **Option A: Quick Setup (Easiest)**

1. **Double-click:** `QUICK_SETUP_AUTO_BACKUP.bat`
2. **Follow the prompts**
3. **Done!** Backups run every 5 minutes automatically

### **Option B: Manual Setup**

1. **Create backup folder:**
   ```bash
   mkdir "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   cd "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   ```

2. **Initialize Git:**
   ```bash
   git init
   echo # Cursor Chat Backups > README.md
   git add README.md
   git commit -m "Initial commit"
   ```

3. **Create auto-backup script:**
   - Copy the content from `auto-backup.bat` template
   - Save as `auto-backup.bat` in backup folder

4. **Create scheduled task:**
   ```bash
   schtasks /Create /TN "CursorChatAutoBackup" /TR "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\auto-backup.bat" /SC MINUTE /MO 5 /F /RL HIGHEST
   ```

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Step 3: Set Up GitHub Backup (Recommended)**

This backs up to GitHub so you never lose chats again!

1. **Create GitHub repository:**
   - Go to: https://github.com/new
   - Name: `cursor-chat-backups`
   - Make it **Private** âœ…
   - Click "Create repository"

2. **Connect to GitHub:**
   ```bash
   cd "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups.git
   git branch -M main
   git push -u origin main
   ```

3. **Done!** Chats auto-push to GitHub every 5 minutes!

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Step 4: Set Up OneDrive Sync (Optional)**

If you have OneDrive, backups will sync automatically:

1. **OneDrive sync is automatic** if you run `QUICK_SETUP_AUTO_BACKUP.bat`
2. **Or manually:** Copy backup folder to OneDrive

---

## âœ… **What Gets Backed Up Automatically**

Every 5 minutes, the system backs up:

- âœ… **All SpecStory conversations** (`.specstory` folder)
- âœ… **Cursor database** (`state.vscdb`)
- âœ… **Workspace storage** (all workspace data)
- âœ… **Everything committed to Git**
- âœ… **Pushed to GitHub** (if configured)
- âœ… **Synced to OneDrive** (if available)

---

## ðŸ”„ **How It Works**

```
Cursor Chat
    â†“
SpecStory Extension (auto-saves)
    â†“
.specstory folder
    â†“
Auto-backup script (every 5 min)
    â†“
Git commit + push
    â†“
GitHub + OneDrive
```

**You do NOTHING!** Just chat normally and everything is backed up automatically.

---

## ðŸ“ **Backup Locations**

### **Local:**
```
C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\
â”œâ”€â”€ conversations\     (SpecStory conversations)
â”œâ”€â”€ databases\         (Cursor database backups)
â””â”€â”€ workspace-storage\ (Workspace data)
```

### **GitHub:**
```
https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups
```

### **OneDrive:**
```
C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups\
```

---

## ðŸŽ¯ **Quick Start Checklist**

- [ ] **Step 1:** Install SpecStory extension in Cursor
- [ ] **Step 2:** Run `QUICK_SETUP_AUTO_BACKUP.bat`
- [ ] **Step 3:** Set up GitHub repository (optional but recommended)
- [ ] **Step 4:** Test - have a conversation, wait 5 minutes, check backup folder

---

## ðŸ§ª **Test Your Setup**

1. **Have a conversation in Cursor**
2. **Wait 5 minutes**
3. **Check:** `C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\conversations`
4. **You should see your conversation!**

---

## ðŸ”§ **Troubleshooting**

### **Backup Not Running?**

1. **Check scheduled task:**
   - Press `Win+R`
   - Type: `taskschd.msc`
   - Look for: `CursorChatAutoBackup`
   - Should be enabled and running

2. **Run manually:**
   ```bash
   "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\auto-backup.bat"
   ```

### **SpecStory Not Saving?**

1. **Verify installation:**
   - Check Extensions in Cursor
   - Ensure SpecStory is enabled

2. **Check folder:**
   - Look for `.specstory` folder in your project
   - If missing, restart Cursor

### **Git Push Failing?**

1. **Check remote:**
   ```bash
   cd "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   git remote -v
   ```

2. **Reconfigure:**
   ```bash
   git remote remove origin
   git remote add origin YOUR_REPO_URL
   git push -u origin main
   ```

---

## ðŸ“š **Files Created**

- `QUICK_SETUP_AUTO_BACKUP.bat` - Quick setup script
- `INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md` - SpecStory installation guide
- `AUTO_BACKUP_SETUP_GUIDE.md` - Detailed guide
- `setup_git_auto_backup.ps1` - PowerShell setup (alternative)

---

## ðŸŽ‰ **You're Done!**

After completing these steps:

âœ… **SpecStory** saves conversations automatically  
âœ… **Auto-backup** runs every 5 minutes  
âœ… **Git** commits and pushes automatically  
âœ… **GitHub** stores your chats in the cloud  
âœ… **OneDrive** syncs backups (if available)  

**You will NEVER lose your chats again!** ðŸŽŠ

---

## ðŸ’¡ **Important Notes**

1. **SpecStory is REQUIRED** - Without it, conversations won't be saved
2. **GitHub backup is RECOMMENDED** - Cloud storage prevents loss
3. **Backups run automatically** - No manual work needed
4. **Check backups regularly** - Verify they're working

---

## ðŸ†˜ **Need Help?**

- See `AUTO_BACKUP_SETUP_GUIDE.md` for detailed instructions
- See `INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md` for SpecStory help
- Check backup folder to verify backups are working

**Start with Step 1 (Install SpecStory) - it's the most important!**

messages.text:
## Automatic backup setup

Created an automatic backup system for your Cursor chats. Follow these steps:

### Step 1: Install SpecStory (required)

This extension automatically saves all conversations.

1. Open Cursor
2. Press `Ctrl+Shift+X` (Extensions)
3. Search: `SpecStory`
4. Click Install
5. Done. Conversations will auto-save.

### Step 2: Run the setup script

Double-click: `QUICK_SETUP_AUTO_BACKUP.bat`

This will:
- Create a backup folder
- Set up Git repository
- Create auto-backup script
- Schedule task to run every 5 minutes
- Sync to OneDrive (if available)

### Step 3: Set up GitHub (recommended)

1. Create a GitHub repository:
   - Go to: https://github.com/new
   - Name: `cursor-chat-backups`
   - Make it Private
   - Create repository

2. Connect it:
   ```bash
   cd "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups"
   git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/cursor-chat-backups.git
   git branch -M main
   git push -u origin main
   ```

### What happens automatically

Every 5 minutes:
- SpecStory conversations are backed up
- Cursor database is backed up
- Everything is committed to Git
- Pushed to GitHub (if configured)
- Synced to OneDrive (if available)

No manual work needed. Just chat normally.

### Files created

- `START_HERE_AUTO_BACKUP.md` â€” Complete guide (read this first)
- `QUICK_SETUP_AUTO_BACKUP.bat` â€” Quick setup script
- `INSTALL_SPECSTORY.md` â€” SpecStory installation
- `AUTO_BACKUP_SETUP_GUIDE.md` â€” Detailed guide

### Quick start

1. Install SpecStory (Step 1 above)
2. Run `QUICK_SETUP_AUTO_BACKUP.bat`
3. Set up GitHub (Step 3 above)
4. Done. Your chats are now auto-backed up.

Start with Step 1 (SpecStory) â€” it's the most important part. After that, your chats will be automatically saved and backed up.

The image displays a GitHub repository page for "123acharya/cursor-conversation" in a dark theme.

**High-Level Overview:**
The page is a standard GitHub repository landing page, showing options for setting up the repository, adding collaborators, and providing command-line instructions for creating or pushing an existing repository.

**Browser and Global Navigation (Top Bar):**
*   The browser's address bar shows `github.com/123acharya/cursor-conversation`.
*   To the right, there's a search bar labeled "Type to search" and various GitHub global navigation icons (e.g., notifications, plus sign for new items, profile picture).
*   A "Ask Google" button and a star icon are also visible in the browser's top right.

**Repository Header:**
*   Below the global navigation, the repository owner and name are displayed: `123acharya / cursor-conversation`.
*   A navigation bar for the repository features tabs: `Code` (currently selected), `Issues`, `Pull requests`, `Actions`, `Projects`, `Wiki`, `Security`, `Insights`, and `Settings`.
*   Below this, the repository name `cursor-conversation` is shown with a "Public" badge next to it.
*   To the right of the repository name, there are action buttons: `Pin`, `Watch 0`, `Fork 0`, and `Star 0`.

**Main Content Area - Top Section:**
This section contains two cards side-by-side:
1.  **"Start coding with Codespaces" card (left):**
    *   An icon resembling a desktop computer.
    *   Text: "Add a README file and start coding in a secure, configurable, and dedicated development environment."
    *   A button: "Create a codespace".
2.  **"Add collaborators to this repository" card (right):**
    *   An icon of a person with a plus sign.
    *   Text: "Search for people using their GitHub username or email address."
    *   A button: "Invite collaborators".

**Main Content Area - Quick Setup Section:**
*   **Title:** "Quick setup â€” if you've done this kind of thing before".
*   Below the title, there are options for setting up:
    *   "Set up in Desktop" (with a desktop icon).
    *   "or"
    *   "HTTPS" (selected, with a copy-to-clipboard icon next to it).
    *   "SSH".
*   The selected HTTPS URL is `https://github.com/123acharya/cursor-conversation.git`.
*   Further instructions state: "Get started by creating a new file or uploading an existing file. We recommend every repository include a README, LICENSE, and .gitignore." The words "creating a new file", "uploading an existing file", "README", "LICENSE", and ".gitignore" are clickable links.

**Main Content Area - Command Line Instructions:**
This section provides two sets of command-line instructions, each in a code block with a copy-to-clipboard icon in the top right corner.

1.  **"...or create a new repository on the command line":**
    ```
    echo "# cursor-conversation" >> README.md
    git init
    git add README.md
    git commit -m "first commit"
    git branch -M main
    git remote add origin https://github.com/123acharya/cursor-conversation.git
    git push -u origin main
    ```
2.  **"...or push an existing repository from the command line":**
    ```
    git remote add origin https://github.com/123acharya/cursor-conversation.git
    git branch -M main
    git push -u origin main
    ```

REM Auto-backup Cursor chats to Git

REM Copy SpecStory conversations from current project
if exist "C:\Users\pc\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups\.specstory" (
    if not exist "conversations" mkdir "conversations"

ECHO is off.

REM Copy Cursor database
set CURSOR_DATA=%APPDATA%\Cursor\User\globalStorage
if exist "%CURSOR_DATA%\state.vscdb" (
    if not exist "databases" mkdir "databases"

echo FIXING AND VERIFYING BACKUP SYSTEM

echo [FIX] Updating auto-backup script with correct paths...
(
echo @echo off
echo REM Auto-backup Cursor chats to Git

echo.
echo REM Push to remote if configured
echo git push origin main ^>nul 2^>^&1 || git push origin master ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo.

echo if exist "%%USERPROFILE%%\OneDrive" (

echo )
) > "%BACKUP_DIR%\auto-backup.bat"

echo    âœ“ Auto-backup script updated

echo.
echo [VERIFY] Checking all components...
echo.

echo [1] Backup directory...
if exist "%BACKUP_DIR%" (
    echo    âœ“ EXISTS: %BACKUP_DIR%
) else (
    echo    âœ— NOT FOUND
    goto :end
)

echo.
echo [2] Git repository...
cd /d "%BACKUP_DIR%"
if exist ".git" (
    echo    âœ“ Git initialized
    git status >nul 2>&1
    if errorlevel 1 (
        echo    âœ— Git not working
    ) else (
        echo    âœ“ Git working
    )
    
    echo.
    echo    Git remote status:
    git remote -v 2>nul
    if errorlevel 1 (
        echo    âš  No remote configured - run setup-git-remote.bat
    ) else (
        echo    âœ“ Remote configured
    )
) else (
    echo    âœ— Git NOT initialized
)

echo.
echo [3] Auto-backup script...
if exist "%BACKUP_DIR%\auto-backup.bat" (
    echo    âœ“ EXISTS
) else (
    echo    âœ— NOT FOUND
)

echo.
echo [4] Scheduled task...
schtasks /Query /TN "CursorChatAutoBackup" >nul 2>&1
if errorlevel 1 (
    echo    âœ— NOT FOUND
    echo.
    echo    Creating scheduled task (requires admin)...
    schtasks /Create /TN "CursorChatAutoBackup" /TR "%BACKUP_DIR%\auto-backup.bat" /SC MINUTE /MO 5 /F /RL HIGHEST 2>nul
    if errorlevel 1 (
        echo    âš  Could not create - run as Administrator
        echo    OR create manually:
        echo      1. Open Task Scheduler (taskschd.msc^)
        echo      2. Create Basic Task
        echo      3. Name: CursorChatAutoBackup

        echo      5. Action: Start program: %BACKUP_DIR%\auto-backup.bat
    ) else (
        echo    âœ“ Scheduled task created!
    )
) else (
    echo    âœ“ EXISTS and ACTIVE
    echo.
    echo    Task status:
    schtasks /Query /TN "CursorChatAutoBackup" /FO LIST | findstr /C:"Status" /C:"Next Run Time"
)

echo.
echo [5] SpecStory check...
echo    Checking for .specstory folders...
set SPECSTORY_FOUND=0
for /d %%d in ("%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\*") do (
    if exist "%%d\.specstory" (
        echo    âœ“ Found: %%~nxd\.specstory
        set SPECSTORY_FOUND=1
    )

if %SPECSTORY_FOUND% EQU 0 (
    echo    âš  No SpecStory folders found
    echo    âš  Make sure SpecStory extension is installed in Cursor
)

call "%BACKUP_DIR%\auto-backup.bat"
if errorlevel 1 (

) else (

)

    if errorlevel 1 (

    ) else (
        for /f %%a in ('dir /B "%BACKUP_DIR%\conversations" 2^>nul ^| find /C /V ""') do echo    âœ“ Found %%a conversation folder(s^)
    )
)

if exist "%BACKUP_DIR%\databases\state.vscdb" (

)

echo.
echo [7] Git status...
cd /d "%BACKUP_DIR%"
git status --short 2>nul
if errorlevel 1 (

) else (

)

echo.

echo VERIFICATION COMPLETE
echo ================================================================================
echo.

:end
pause

codeBlocks.content:
@echo off
set BACKUP_DIR=%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\cursor-chat-backups

echo Creating auto-backup script...

(
echo @echo off
echo REM Auto-backup Cursor chats to Git
echo cd /d "%BACKUP_DIR%"
echo.
echo REM Copy SpecStory conversations from Desktop projects
echo for /d %%%%d in ("%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\*"^) do (
echo     if exist "%%%%d\.specstory" (
echo         if not exist "conversations" mkdir "conversations"
echo         echo Backing up SpecStory from: %%%%d
echo         xcopy /E /I /Y "%%%%d\.specstory" "conversations\%%%%~nxd\" ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo     )
echo )
echo.
echo REM Copy Cursor database
echo set CURSOR_DATA=%%%%APPDATA%%%%\Cursor\User\globalStorage
echo if exist "%%%%CURSOR_DATA%%%%\state.vscdb" (
echo     if not exist "databases" mkdir "databases"
echo     copy /Y "%%%%CURSOR_DATA%%%%\state.vscdb" "databases\state.vscdb" ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo )
echo.
echo REM Copy workspace storage
echo if exist "%%%%APPDATA%%%%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" (
echo     if not exist "workspace-storage" mkdir "workspace-storage"
echo     xcopy /E /I /Y "%%%%APPDATA%%%%\Cursor\User\workspaceStorage" "workspace-storage\" ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo )
echo.
echo REM Git operations
echo git add -A
echo git commit -m "Auto-backup: %%%%date%%%% %%%%time%%%%" --allow-empty ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo.
echo REM Push to remote if configured
echo git push origin main ^>nul 2^>^&1 || git push origin master ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo.
echo REM Sync to OneDrive if available
echo if exist "%%%%USERPROFILE%%%%\OneDrive" (
echo     if not exist "%%%%USERPROFILE%%%%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups" mkdir "%%%%USERPROFILE%%%%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups"
echo     xcopy /E /I /Y "%BACKUP_DIR%" "%%%%USERPROFILE%%%%\OneDrive\Cursor-Chat-Backups\" ^>nul 2^>^&1
echo )
) > "%BACKUP_DIR%\auto-backup.bat"

echo âœ“ Auto-backup script created at: %BACKUP_DIR%\auto-backup.bat
